channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023071034
item.description:
Report X-2023071034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: P&D DRIVER PICKED UP PACKAGE FROM SHIPPER AND LATER NOTICED A GASOLINE SMELL. CSA WENT AND RETRIEVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE DRIVER AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE STATION. WHEN WE OBSERVED THE PACKAGE, WE NOTICED THE SMELL OF GASOLINE AND THAT SOME OF THE BOX ON THE INSIDE WAS WET FROM IT LEAKING. DescribePack: THERE WAS NO DAMAGE. THIS WAS AN RTS PACKAGE GOING BACK TO WALMART THAT THE SHIPPER DID NOT COMPLETELY BLED THE LINES OF FLUIDS. IT IS A USED LAWN MOWER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT LEAKED OUT AND THE BOX ABSORBED IT.

item.title: Report X-2023071161
item.description:
Report X-2023071161

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload called QA to pick up leaking hazmat from unload. PPE used blue gloves, mask and googles. I out on all PPE and placed the leaking haz-mat into a lined black tote. DescribePack: one of the glass jugs had a loose cap, causing a internal leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed leaking haz mat in a lines black tote

item.title: Report X-2023071092
item.description:
Report X-2023071092

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: VSA got notice from driver about the damage hazmat in their truck; was damaged around 5pm, got driver to pull truck aside from building and remove package, broken glass, and sweep inside the truck. Took package with the broken glass away from the building until being staged in Hazmat Cage. DescribePack: Top of package's tape was loose and one bottle fell out during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Clean up the truck and removed the damaged glass.

CAP MISALIGNED IN TWO PLACES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PAIL WAS BAGGED. ALL CLEAN-UP AND DAMAGED MATERIALS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by hazmat cage. Upon further inspection it was determined that the package was suffering from overpressure causing it to leak from the cap by force. DescribePack: The package was suffering from overpressure causing it to leak from the cap by force. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and then processed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was laid on its side by the pickoff. The package started leaking. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed upright in a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Package contents had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright in a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Package was wet but contents did not extend/leak beyond the box.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found in the QA work area discovered wet, first I put my safety gloves on and hazmat gear before opening the package when I checked the contents, one cap was loose and leaked out its contents. I proceeded to check the other gallons to make sure they didn't have loose caps as well, they were tight and sealed. DescribePack: The gallon had a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To stop the release, I tightened the cap onto the gallon jug.

item.title: Report X-2023070893
item.description:
Report X-2023070893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Management had someone inbound the ICs at the front of belt 1. This person found the hazmat damaged and immediately notified belt 1 manager. This occurred prior to the arrival of any QA personnel so the manager placed the item in a bin and brought it to QA 1. DescribePack: The packaging has come undone from the area in which it was originally glued/sealed together. The tape at the base of the package came completely off and the tape at the top is only attached to the top front flap. The only side of the package that appears to not have any damage is the front, the rest of the sides appear to be wet damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When management was first made aware of the damaged hazmat, the package was removed from the loading area and brought to QA in a bin. As soon as QA was made aware the contents were secured in a yellow salvage drum and secured to be processed post sort.

item.title: Report E-2023070715
item.description:
Report E-2023070715

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading the IBC into a van trailer, a Veolia operator noticed the IBC had leaked nearly a gallon of waste on to the ground. The leak appeared to be coming from a outlet on the bottom of the valve. The valve would have to fail for this to happen. The outlet was plugged with spill pads temporarily to contain the leak and the waste was transferred in to another tote for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2023070694
item.description:
Report E-2023070694

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and a 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt yard. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to loose caps on almost all the 1-gallon plastic jugs on the pallet. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel removed all the plastic jugs from the cardboard packaging and verified that all the jugs were impacted from the pallet. Lone Star Hazmat Response deployed Sodium Bicarbonate to neutralize the impacted areas and then placed down Oil Dri as an absorbent. The spent material was gathered and placed into two 55-gallon poly drums along with the impacted cardboard. The impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were containerized into two 95-gallon poly drums and two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was labeled and staged in a secure location onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023070840
item.description:
Report X-2023070840

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As per unload manager at approximately 0430 the trailer in which the package was loaded in was opened and the first thing, he saw was the hazmat package damaged at the tail end of the trailer. QA was notified, the package was collected and placed in a hazmat drum to be processed later by QA. DescribePack: The right front corner, from top to bottom was damaged. Approximately 8in x 3in rectangle shaped piece of the package tore off. The bottom edge of the box was torn open and wet approximately 12in. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was notified about the damaged hazmat, someone went to investigate. As soon as it was verified that it was indeed a damaged hazmat it was collected and placed in a hazmat drum and stored at the QA cage to prevent any other items from being damaged or anybody from being injured by its contents.

item.title: Report E-2023070677
item.description:
Report E-2023070677

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: ALVIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/7/2023, at 11:00 am driver prepared to deliver Sodium Bisulfite 38% - NaHS03.The driver pulled the hose out from the hose reel. During the initial hook up to the customers tank with the pump engaged, the connection between the hose reel and hose assembly began leaking in the reel box, causing a release of product on the ground. After shutting down the system, the customer immediately was informed and they were able to contain the product from all ditches and drains, then used an on-site vacuum truck to collect the spill. The driver informed his supervisor, the supervisor informed his manager. The amount of the spill was approximately 55 gallons. There was no exposure to any of the customer employees or Univar employee. There were no injuries

item.title: Report E-2023070613
item.description:
Report E-2023070613

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a UN3267 Plurasafe Concentrate 1225 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The bottom of the drum was cracked due to a pallet puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were then placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler who was unloading discovered package in trailer leaking, was reported immediately to operations manager running unload Rolando Alvarez. Information of Hazmat was then relayed to Quality assurance who picked up hazmat package using proper safety equipment and put into yellow hazmat drum. Then used soaking agent powder to soak up spilled liquid and clean area. DescribePack: Package was soiled by liquid spilling from gallon that had loose caps causing box to be torn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quality Assurance used proper safety equipment to pick up hazmat and place into yellow hazmat drum. Then proceeded to use soaking agent powder to soak up leakage and clean area corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023070706
item.description:
Report X-2023070706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED WETTNESS ON THE BOX AND IMMEDIATLY CALLED FOR SORT MANAGER PAUL. ONCE PAUL INVESTIGATED, HE CALLED QA ON THE RADIO TO COME HELP WITH THE REMOVAL OF THE DAMAGED HAZMAT. QA TYLER USED PROPER SAFETY EQUIPMENT AND A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM TO MITIGATE THE DAMAGE. NO CLEANUP NEEDED, LEAKAGE STAYED ON BOX. DescribePack: BOX HAD LEAKAGE ALL ON THE CORNER OF THE BOX, CAP WAS LOOSE AND LEAKED INTERNALLY. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: USING SAFETY EQUIPMENT SUCH AS GLOVES, APRON, GLASSES & GETTING THE SALVAGE DRUM TO CONTAIN ANY ADDITIONAL SPILL.

item.title: Report X-2023070698
item.description:
Report X-2023070698

  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED WET SPOT ON HAZMAT IN TRAILER, REPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE UNLOAD MANAGER ROLANDO. WHO THEN REPORTED TO QA TO CLEAN UP WITH SAFETY EQUIPMENT. QA TYLER GRABBED YELLOW HAZMAT DRUMS TO PUT THE LEAKING HAZMAT INTO WHILE USING PROPER SAFETY EQUIPMENT. NO CLEAN UP WAS NEEDED DUE TO LEAKAGE ONLY ON BOX. DescribePack: THE BOX HAD IN TWO DIFFERENT CORNERS WET/CORROSION SPOTS DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QUICK RESPONSIVENESS, CONTAINING THE DAMAGE IN THE YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023070697
item.description:
Report X-2023070697

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070697 SequenceEvent: OPS MANAGER LET ME KNOW THERE WAS A DAMAGE HAZMAT IN THE UNLOAD AT DOOR 9. SHE PLACED IN A TOTE. THE STEEL PAIL WAS DAMAGED DUE TO A PACKAGE HANDLER LEANING A HEAVY NC PACKAGE UP AGAINST THE ROLLERS AND IT FELL ONTO THE PAIL, DENTING THE LID AND THE LIQUID INSIDE LEAKED OUT A LITTLE. DescribePack: DENTED LID. DENTED IN SEVERAL AREAS OF THE LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WAS PLACED IN A TOTE TO PREVENT ANY FURTHER LEAKAGE ONTO THE DOCK FLOOR. 2. X-2023070748 SequenceEvent: I DO NOT KNOW WHAT HAPPENED TO THE BOX AS THIS WAS AN INSPECTION CODE 10 BY THE DRIVER AT 12:39PM ON MONDAY AFTERNOON DescribePack: LOOSE LID INSIDE THE BOX DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: OUR STATION RECEIVED AN EMAIL FROM OUR OUTBOUND QA STATING THAT ONE OF OUR P&D MANAGERS TOLD HER TO THAT MORNING QA NEEDED TO PROCESS THIS PACKAGE ON WEDNESDAY MORNING.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3264 Bonderite M-ZN 450R release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released impacting a 5â€™ x 8â€™ area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 15' area of the concrete lot below due to a pallet nail puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070398
item.description:
Report E-2023070398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 2300-pound UN2794 battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of battery acid released impacting the trailer floor and an 8' x 30' area of concrete lot below due to the battery falling off a forklift. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and utilized to clean the released acid. The battery was decontaminated, the caps were re-secured, and the battery was secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: The skid of UN1791 was loaded on a mobile platform. As the mobile platform was being pulled off the trailer, the nozzle on the lid of a drum struck the trailer and was broken off, causing the spill.

Drive did take it to VSA- PPE used gloves and googles. VSA place leaking haz mat into lines haz mat tote for further processing DescribePack: cap came off from the force of the drop DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: VSA placed leaking hazmat into lines tote

item.title: Report E-2023070140
item.description:
Report E-2023070140

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: HUMBLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLDWIDE FLIGHT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/23/2023 at 1845, Cargo Ramp Crew Agent was preparing the CA4 gate for the arrival of TK6060. Two shipments of class 9 barrels on skids for Eva Air were briefly staged outside of the warehouse to clear the DG for the TK flight. Personnel attempted to move the barrels to make room for the arriving flight. As he did so, his forks punctured one of the barrels as his forks went through a skid and hit the barrel behind the load that he was carrying. All of the contents of the barrel spilled on the ramp and some into the drainage. IAH Airport Operations was notified with HFD responding. NRC and TECQ were notified.
